title: Problem 2128_D
statement: You're given a permutation^{\text{∗}} p_1, ..., p_n such that \max(p_i, p_{i+1}) > p_{i+2} for all 1 ≤q i ≤q n-2.Compute the sum of the length of the longest decreasing subsequence^{\text{†}} of the subarray [p_l, p_{l+1}, ..., p_r] over all pairs 1 ≤q l ≤q r ≤q n.^{\text{∗}}A permutation of length n is an array consisting of n distinct integers from 1 to n in arbitrary order.
